titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: William Keesecker (1918-1992) was a Presbyterian minister. A native of Washington, Kansas, he graduated from McCormick Theological Seminary. He served pastorates in Illinois, Iowa, and Kansas, and was a U.S. Navy Chaplain from 1945-1946. In 1975, he was elected to serve as Moderator of the General Assembly of the United Presbyterian Church.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the correspondence of William Keesecker relating to his service as Moderator of the General Assembly. The correspondence, incoming and outgoing, dates from 1974 to 1977 and documents the day to day responsibilities of the Moderator. Some of the correspondence is accompanied by clippings, bulletins, and brochures. The collection also includes some legal files, possibly from the office of James Mackellar, Assistant to the Stated Clerk.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
